name: Dakify
description:
Creates dakimakura aka body pillow designs.

This model is kind of an experiment I'm doing to learn about tagging and LoRAs. It's still a work in progress, but is functional enough to share it so far.

It can be difficult to replicate a scene and character across different seeds, so I wanted to see if I could generate both sides of a body pillow in a single generation, in a way that they are similar enough to use the same character but have predictable differences on each side. There are still some issues to work out but so far, the results have been pretty effective, especially on NAI-based models.

modelVersions.name: v0.8 Beta
modelVersions.description:
READ ME:

Trained on over 120 512 x 816 images of 2-sided dakimakura pillow designs for 10 epochs.

Be sure to set the base output resolution to 512 x 816 for proper results. Hi res fixes are fine, but the further you get from a 10:16 aspect ratio, the less the LoRA will be able to work.

CONTROL TAGS:

Add these to your prompt to direct the design of the alt (backside) of the pillow:

  • alt:flipped - Alt side shows subject from behind.

  • alt:stripped - Alt side has subject showing more skin.

  • alt:sideview - Alt side shows subject from a horizontal perspective.

  • alt:pose - Alt side shows subject in a different (ideally more dynamic) pose.

  • alt:torn - Alt side has ripped clothes. (Currently this will likely manifest on both sides, but in different amounts.)

  • alt:costume - Alt side shows subject in different clothes or color scheme.

A weight of 1 is usually sufficient, but setting it higher may be necessary when used in tandem with other LoRAs and hypernetworks.

meta.prompt: masterpiece, ultra hd, high quality, alt:flipped
meta.negativePrompt: ((lowres, bad anatomy, bad hands bad face, text, error, missing fingers, extra digit, fewer digits, cropped, worst quality, low quality, normal quality, jpeg artifacts, signature, watermark, username, blurry, artist name))
